string.name: protectionTipsString
string.li: Always be aware of your surroundings and trust your instincts.
Keep your phone charged and easily accessible.
Share your location with a trusted friend and family member.
Carry a personal safety alarm or whistle.
Avoid sharing personal information with any strangers.

resources.string: Drop, Cover, and Hold: \nIn the event of a fire, remember to drop to the ground, cover your mouth and nose with a cloth, and hold on until the danger has passed.

Signal in case of kidnapping, domestic violence or in any harm.
Raising your hand with your palm facing inward, tucking your thumb inside your fist, and closing your fingers over it.

string.name: aboutAlone
string.li: Stick to Well-Lit and Populated Areas: Avoid walking alone in deserted or poorly lit areas, especially at night.
Plan Your Route: Know where you're going and how you'll get there before you head out.
Trust Your Gut: If a situation feels unsafe, remove yourself from it. Don't be afraid to change course or call for a ride.
Limit Distractions: Avoid wearing headphones with loud music or being engrossed in your phone while walking alone. Stay alert to your surroundings.
Carry Less Valuables: Take only what you need and avoid carrying large sums of cash or expensive jewelry.
